segment.source: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders (Windows 10)
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: This security audit policy and the event that it records are generated when the central access policy that is associated with a file or folder is changed.
segment.target: This security audit policy and the event that it records are generated when the central access policy that is associated with a file or folder is changed.

segment.source: This security audit policy is useful when an administrator wants to monitor potential changes on some, but not all, files and folders on a file server.
segment.target: This security audit policy is useful when an administrator wants to monitor potential changes on some, but not all, files and folders on a file server.

segment.source: For info about monitoring potential central access policy changes for an entire file server, see Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server.
segment.target: For info about monitoring potential central access policy changes for an entire file server, see Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor central access policies that are associated with files.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor central access policies that are associated with files.

segment.source: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network.
segment.target: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure and deploy Dynamic Access Control, see Dynamic Access Control: Scenario Overview.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure and deploy Dynamic Access Control, see Dynamic Access Control: Scenario Overview.

segment.source: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.
segment.target: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.

segment.source: To configure settings to monitor central access policies associated with files or folders
segment.target: To configure settings to monitor central access policies associated with files or folders

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.
segment.target: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click the flexible access Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click the flexible access Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.

segment.source: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Security Settings, double-click Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, double-click Policy Change, and then double-click Audit Authorization Policy Change.
segment.target: Double-click Computer Configuration, double-click Security Settings, double-click Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, double-click Policy Change, and then double-click Audit Authorization Policy Change.

segment.source: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.
segment.target: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.

segment.source: Enable auditing for a file or folder as described in the following procedure.
segment.target: Enable auditing for a file or folder as described in the following procedure.

segment.source: To enable auditing for a file or folder
segment.target: To enable auditing for a file or folder

segment.source: Sign in as a member of the local administrators group on the computer that contains the files or folders that you want to audit.
segment.target: Sign in as a member of the local administrators group on the computer that contains the files or folders that you want to audit.

segment.source: Right-click the file or folder, click Properties, and then click the Security tab.
segment.target: Right-click the file or folder, click Properties, and then click the Security tab.

segment.source: Click Advanced, click the Auditing tab, and then click Continue.
segment.target: Click Advanced, click the Auditing tab, and then click Continue.

segment.source: If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click Yes.
segment.target: If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click Yes.

segment.source: Click Add, click Select a principal, type a user name or group name in the format contosouser1, and then click OK.
segment.target: Click Add, click Select a principal, type a user name or group name in the format contosouser1, and then click OK.

segment.source: In the Auditing Entry for dialog box, select the permissions that you want to audit, such as Full Control or Delete.
segment.target: In the Auditing Entry for dialog box, select the permissions that you want to audit, such as Full Control or Delete.

segment.source: Click OK four times to complete the configuration of the object SACL.
segment.target: Click OK four times to complete the configuration of the object SACL.

segment.source: Open a File Explorer window and select or create a file or folder to audit.
segment.target: Open a File Explorer window and select or create a file or folder to audit.

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt, and run the following command:
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt, and run the following command:

segment.source: After you configure settings to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders, verify that the changes are being monitored.
segment.target: After you configure settings to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders, verify that the changes are being monitored.

segment.source: To verify that changes to central access policies associated with files and folders are monitored
segment.target: To verify that changes to central access policies associated with files and folders are monitored

segment.source: Sign in as a member of the local administrators group on the computer that contains the files or folders that you want to audit.
segment.target: Sign in as a member of the local administrators group on the computer that contains the files or folders that you want to audit.

segment.source: Open a File Explorer window and select the file or folder that you configured for auditing in the previous procedure.
segment.target: Open a File Explorer window and select the file or folder that you configured for auditing in the previous procedure.

segment.source: Right-click the file or folder, click Properties, click the Security tab, and then click Advanced.
segment.target: Right-click the file or folder, click Properties, click the Security tab, and then click Advanced.

segment.source: Click the Central Policy tab, click Change, and select a different central access policy (if one is available) or select No Central Access Policy, and then click OK twice.
segment.target: Click the Central Policy tab, click Change, and select a different central access policy (if one is available) or select No Central Access Policy, and then click OK twice.

segment.source: Note: You must select a setting that is different than your original setting to generate the audit event.
segment.target: Note: You must select a setting that is different than your original setting to generate the audit event.

segment.source: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.
segment.target: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.

segment.source: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.
segment.target: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.

segment.source: Look for event 4913, which is generated when the central access policy that is associated with a file or folder is changed.
segment.target: Look for event 4913, which is generated when the central access policy that is associated with a file or folder is changed.

segment.source: This event includes the security identifiers (SIDs) of the old and new central access policies.
segment.target: This event includes the security identifiers (SIDs) of the old and new central access policies.

segment.source: Related resource
segment.target: Related resource

segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
